titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Herbert Dorn was born in Germany, and lived in Switzerland and Cuba before immigrating to America and becoming an American citizen. Dorn was an economist specializing in matters of international trade and law, who held a number of professional positions in several countries before joining the University of Delaware faculty as a Research Professor of Economics and the Chairman of the Institute for Inter-American Study and Research.

scopecontent.p: The Herbert Dorn papers consist of material dating from 1900 to 1955. The collection contains material relating to his various professional interests and activities, and includes notebooks, lecture notes, research files, books, manuscripts, clippings, and posters. Materials are in German and English.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/dorn.htm.
